chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
is_true (sv \in cs1)

Premises:
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
cs1 = [:: 1] : Exports.input
sv = 1 : nid
delegating_body : forall l1 l2 : Label, l2 != l1 -> forall (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs1 cls1 cs2 cls2 : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs1 -> sv \in cls2 -> forall sd : nid, sd \in cs2 -> delegating_body_spec l1 l2 f prec cs1 cls1 cs2 cls2 sv

receive_msg : forall (l1 : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs1 cls1 : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs1 -> DT sv (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv (ii l1 f prec cs1 cls1))) (nid * input)
send_ans : forall (l1 : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs1 cls1 : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs1 -> nid -> Exports.input -> nat -> DT sv (mkWorld (ProtocolWithIndInv (ii l1 f prec cs1 cls1))) Exports.input
send_answer : forall (l : Label) (f : Exports.input -> option nat) (prec : Exports.input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs -> forall (to : nid) (args : Exports.input) (ans : nat), {ps : reqs}, DHT [sv,mkWorld (Exports.CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)] ( fun i : state => [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> ps, to \in cls, (to, sv, args) \in ps & f args = Some ans], fun (r : Exports.input) (m : state) => getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> SeqLib.remove_elem ps (to, sv, args) /\ r = ans :: args)
blocking_receive_req : forall (l : Label) (f : Exports.input -> option nat) (prec : Exports.input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs -> {ps : reqs}, DHT [sv,mkWorld (Exports.CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)] ( fun i : state => getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> ps, fun (r : nid * input) (m : state) => [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> ((r.1, sv, r.2) :: ps), r.1 \in cls & prec r.2])
receive_req_loop : forall (l : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs -> forall (bsize : nat) (s : unit), DHT [sv,mkWorld (CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)] ( fun i : state => getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> [::] /\ BatchingServer.state_wf s, fun (r : reqs * unit) (m : state) => [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> r.1, size r.1 = bsize, forall e : prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType), e \in r.1 -> [/\ e.1.1 \in cls, e.1.2 = sv & prec e.2] & BatchingServer.state_wf r.2])
delegate_f : forall (l2 : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs2 cls2 : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cls2 -> forall (sd : nid) (args : Exports.input), DHT [sv,mkWorld (cal_with_inv l2 f prec cs2 cls2)] ( fun i : state => [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet i l2) = st :-> [::], prec args & sd \in cs2], fun (res : nat) (m : state) => getLocal sv (getStatelet m l2) = st :-> [::] /\ f args = Some res)
batched_body : forall (l : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool), (forall i : input, prec i -> exists v : nat, f i = Some v) -> forall (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs -> nat -> unit -> server_loop_body_spec l f prec cs cls sv unit BatchingServer.state_wf BatchingServer.state0
CalculatorServerLib.send_answer_obligation_1 : forall (l : Label) (f : Exports.input -> option nat) (prec : Exports.input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs -> forall (to : nid) (args : Exports.input) (ans : nat), conseq (send_ans_act l f prec cs cls sv to (ans :: args)) (logvar (fun ps : reqs => binarify (fun i : state => [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> ps, to \in cls, (to, sv, args) \in ps & f args = Some ans]) (fun (r : Exports.input) (m : state) => getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> SeqLib.remove_elem ps (to, sv, args) /\ r = ans :: args)))
send_ans_loop : forall (l : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool), (forall i : input, prec i -> exists v : nat, f i = Some v) -> forall (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), sv \in cs -> forall acc : reqs, DHT [sv,mkWorld (CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)] ( fun i : state => getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> acc /\ (forall e : prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType), e \in acc -> [/\ e.1.1 \in cls, e.1.2 = sv & prec e.2]), fun (r : unit) (m : state) => getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> [::] /\ BatchingServer.state_wf r)
mem_cat : forall (T : eqType) (x : T) (s1 s2 : seq T), (x \in s1 ++ s2) = (x \in s1) || (x \in s2)
batch_recv_loop_spec = fun (l : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid) (bsize : nat) => forall nsa : nat * unit * reqs, DHT [sv,mkWorld (CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)] ( fun i : state => let '(n, s, acc) := nsa in [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> acc, size acc + n = bsize, forall e : prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType), e \in acc -> [/\ e.1.1 \in cls, e.1.2 = sv & prec e.2] & BatchingServer.state_wf s], fun (r : reqs * unit) (m : state) => [/\ getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> r.1, size r.1 = bsize, forall e : prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType), e...
batch_send_loop_spec = fun (l : Label) (f : input -> option nat) (prec : input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid) => forall acc : reqs, DHT [sv,mkWorld (CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)] ( fun i : state => getLocal sv (getStatelet i l) = st :-> acc /\ (forall e : prod_eqType (prod_eqType nat_eqType nat_eqType) (seq_eqType nat_eqType), e \in acc -> [/\ e.1.1 \in cls, e.1.2 = sv & prec e.2]), fun (r : unit) (m : state) => getLocal sv (getStatelet m l) = st :-> ([::] : reqs) /\ BatchingServer.state_wf r) : Label -> (input -> option nat) -> (input -> bool) -> seq nid -> seq nid -> nid -> Type Arguments batch_send_loop_spec _ (_ _)%function_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
in_cons : forall (T : eqType) (y : T) (s : seq T) (x : T), (x \in y :: s) = (x == y) || (x \in s)
cohMsg = fun (prec : input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (ms : msg TaggedMessage) => let body := content ms in if tag body == resp then [/\ from ms \in cs, to ms \in cls & exists (v : nat) (args : Exports.input), body = [:: v] ++ args] else [/\ tag body == req, from ms \in cls, to ms \in cs & exists args : Exports.input, body = args /\ prec args] : (input -> bool) -> seq nid -> seq nid -> msg TaggedMessage -> Prop Arguments cohMsg _%function_scope (_ _)%seq_scope
Actions.can_send = fun (p : protocol) (this : nid) (l : Label) (s : state) => (l \in dom (cT:=union_mapUMC Label dstatelet) s) && (this \in nodes p (getStatelet s l)) : protocol -> nid -> Label -> state -> bool
send_ans_act : forall (l : Label) (f : Exports.input -> option nat) (prec : Exports.input -> bool) (cs cls : seq nid) (sv : nid), nid -> Exports.input -> DT sv (mkWorld (Exports.CalculatorProtocol f prec cs cls l)) Exports.input
